result.execSummary:
The defendant Marcus Anthony Jones was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500 [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant to report to Probation today September 13, 2022
Court notes credit if revoked from Probation.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution to victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

$400.00 restitution to be collected by DOC as a condition of probation in Count 1 Case #15CM265.

records.addlTxt: JOC's/Dismissals returned from PO "Insufficient Address" Unable to Forward. eif
Restitution Summary of $400.00 to M.Q.K. and $40.00 to C.K.K. To ELR for review. eif

11:34 AM Defendant Marcus Anthony Jones in Court.  Attorney Daniel P Repka in Court for Marcus Anthony Jones.  ADA Kaley Walker in court for State of Wisconsin.  Includes 15CM265, 22CF60, 22TR292, 22TR293, 22TR294.  ADA Walker recites agreement; Defendant pleading to 15CM265, 1 year Probation, $443 costs, $440 restitution joint/several, 1 day credit if revoked.  Defendant pleading to 22CF60, DJOC for one year, notes conditions.  Defendant pleading to 22TR292.  County moving to dismiss 22TR293 & 22TR294.  Atty. Repka confirms agreement and advises Plea Questionnaire just filed.  He does not represent Defendant on 15CM265.  Court questions basis for DJOC, ADA Walker advises.  Atty. Repka reviews Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights with Defendant.  Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and constitutional rights.  Defendant pleads Guilty to 15CM265 & 22CF60.  Attorneys stipulate to facts.  Court finds a factual basis to accept the Plea.  Court finds Defendant is freely, voluntarily and knowingly making plea and waiving constitutional rights.  Court notes review of rights by Atty. Repka and notes waiver of counsel as to 15CM265.  Court finds Defendant Guilty of 15CM265 and enters conviction.  Court finds Defendant Guilty of 22CF60, entry of conviction deferred pending approval of DJOC.  Defendant pleads Guilty to 22TR292.  Court finds Defendant Guilty.  22TR293 and 22TR294 dismissed.  ADA Walker states position and notes compliance with victim's rights.  Court notes review of VIS in 15CM265.  Atty. Repka states position.  Defendant makes statement.  Court sentences Defendant.  On 22TR292 court orders forfeiture of $175.30, 3 points, one year to pay.  On 15CM265, sentence W/H.  One year Probation.  $443 court costs.  $440 restitution, joint/several ($400 and $40).  Other specific conditions to be set by Agent.   One day credit if revoked from Probation.  On 22CF60 Court approves DJOC for one year and signs.  Defendant to report to Probation today.  Appeal rights given.  Adjourned at 12:15 PM
Return to Sender/No Such Number/Unable to Forward)

1:07 PM Defendant Marcus Anthony Jones appears in Court, Atty Daniel P Repka appears by phone, ADA Kaley Walker appears for the State of Wisconsin. Includes 22CF60, 15CM265, 22TR292, 22TR293 and 22TR294 (STC). Atty Repka states this are moving forward and would like a PH. ADA Walker suggests this be set for a PH. Atty Repka states DE is now in aftercare so he would be available. ADA Walker does not object to a remote appearance if it is a waiver. Atty Repka states it will be a waiver, zoom appearance is approved. Atty Repka to submit a waiver to the Court. Other cases to follow. Court adjourned at 1:12 pm.  Status conference scheduled for July 25, 2022 at 04:00 pm.

3:28 PM Defendant Marcus Anthony Jones appears from Jail via video, Atty Daniel P Repka appears by phone, ADA Joseph M. Schieffer appears for the State of Wisconsin.  Includes 22CF60, 15CM265, 22TR292, 22TR293 and 22TR294 (IN).  Court informs Defendant of charges, and possible penalties and rights. Defendant understands.  Court reviews DE's rights. ADA Schieffer is requesting a $10,000.00 SIBS w/condition NTO, no objection. Court so orders. Court will quash the warrant on 15CM265 and reinstate the bond. On 22TR292, 22TR293 and 22TR294 Atty Repka enters NG pleas and will follow the felony. Atty Repka may appear by phone for the next hearing. Court confirms address and phone. Court adjourned at 3:38 pm

4:09 Defendant Marcus Anthony Jones in court  VIA VIDEO CONFERENCING FROM PCJ, in custody.  Sean Edward Froelich appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Chris Bub appeared in court via phone. Froelich requests warrant be quashed. Court quashes warrant.   Defendant has copy of complaint. Court reads charges and possible penalties.  Defendant waives reading of the complaint  Constitutional rights explained to defendant. Exam'd re: understanding of law, penalty and rights. Def pleas not guilty. Court rec/enter. Froelich: $2000 signature bond. Bub has no objection. It is not known if the Def qualifies for the PD. Court goes over bond conditions with Def. Def has not been in the armed services.
